result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy P Sheedy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $50 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy P Sheedy in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea. Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty. Court dismisses 16-FO-108 but reads in for sentencing. Atty Pelrine makes sentencing statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy P Sheedy

Prior: 916 Quincy St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Jeremy P Sheedy in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
